## Fitting discrete-time movement models with the moveHMM pakcage

Discrete-time package that allows us to do some nice things really, really easily.

```{r}
# Load in the pig data
library(data.table)
dt = fread("../data/formatted/full_pig_data_cleaned.csv")
```

Convert datetimes back to datetimes

```{r}
dt$datetime = as.POSIXct(strptime(dt$datetime, format="%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S", tz="GMT"))
```

Subset to only include the Texas study

```{r}
txdt = dt[study == "txcamp"]
table(txdt$pigID)
length(unique(txdt$pigID))
```

There are 39 unique pigs in the texas dataset. Just for practice, let's focus on one. 

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
pig1 = txdt[pigID == "20125txcamp"]
deltas = diff(pig1$datetime)
ggplot(data=NULL) + geom_histogram(aes(x=as.numeric(deltas)))
```

```{r}
plot(pig1$datetime, pig1$longitude, type="l")
plot(pig1$datetime, pig1$latitude, type="l")
```
